name: siebelscriptandwebtempeditor
displayName: Siebel Script And Web Template Editor
description: Enables the editing of Siebel object server scripts and web templates in VSCode and updating them in Siebel using the Siebel REST API

activitybar.title: Siebel Script And Web Template Editor

configuration.title: Siebel Script And Web Template Editor

siebelScriptAndWebTempEditor.REST Endpoi.markdownDescription:
Parameteres for connection to the Siebel REST API, use the following format:  
`CUSTOMNAME/USERNAME/PASSWORD@SIEBELRESTENDPOINT`, e.g.  
`DEVENV/USERNAME/PASSWORD@https://devclient.devdomain.com/siebel/v1.0`  
Press the Reload button on the extension after editing this setting!

siebelScriptAndWebTempEditor.workspaces.markdownDescription:
Workspaces to use for the different connections, multiple can be given for each connection, use a colon after the connection, then the workspace names separated by commas, one is mandatory:  
`CUSTOMNAME:WORKSPACENAME1,WORKSPACENAME2`, e.g.  
`DEVENV:custom_dev_ws,other_dev_ws`  
Press the Reload button on the extension after editing this setting!

siebelScriptAndWebTempEditor.defaultConn.markdownDescription: Use the 'Set as default' button in the extension to change it. Name of the default REST connection and workspace to use, e.g. `DEVENV:custom_dev_ws`

siebelScriptAndWebTempEditor.getWorkspac.markdownDescription:
If you have the 'Base Workspace' integration object in your Siebel primary branch, by checking this setting you can get the workspaces from the Siebel REST API, no need to fill them manually under the Workspaces setting. The integration object to import can be found in the repository of the extension, under the name `BaseWorkspaceIOB.sif`. See the [documentation](https://github.com/endoit/siebelScriptsEditor/blob/main/documentation.md#213-getting-workspace-data-from-rest) for more information.  
Press the Reload button on the extension after editing this setting!
